content.content: I decided to build this website application using javascript. The website is client rendered using React, and I run this website in a UNIX terminal. I structured the website to use a json description for each of the pages. I set up a Linux subsystem for my programming (as it is a more versatile and widely used operating system for machine learning applications) and use the command line for git and installing software’s and libraries.
This website contains articles covering a variety of topics, such as:

items: My understanding of how various machine learning techniques work
How I coded up the applications of machine learning techniques

content.content: I have a first-class BSc (Hons) in marine biology and an MScRes in ocean sciences currently under assessment, both from Bangor University.
I am currently doing a machine learning course (using Python) by
Kirill Eremenko and Hadelin de Ponteves on Udemy

items: Deep learning (artificial neural network and convolutional neural network for computer vision) using Tensorflow
Reinforcement learning (upper confidence bound and Thompson sampling)
Regression (simple and multiple linear, polynomial, support vector, decision tree and random forest)
Classification (logistic regression, k nearest neighbours, support vector machine, kernel support vector machine, naïve bayes, decision tree and random forest)

content.content: Whilst undertaking my machine learning course, I used my new skills to create a convolutional neural network trained to identify my photos (see ‘Convolutional Neural Networks’) and a classification application (see ‘Classification Application’). I decided to do these projects to solidify my understanding of what I learnt on the course, and gain more experience using python, as I only started using it when I began this course.
During my MScRes, I wrote a fully documented, downloadable R package for my data analysis, which can be viewed in my
. The statistical methods I used include:

I code in python and R, and through creating this website have gained experience with javascript, html and CSS. Throughout my BSc Marine Biology and MScRes Ocean Sciences, I have gained experience using GIS software such as ArcGIS and statistical software such as Excel, SPSS and Primer, MATLAB, and data portals such as EMODnet and Digimap.
